alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 11 at 8:37PM MDT until June 15 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton WY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Wind River Basin...including areas near Dubois, Crowheart, Kinnear, Riverton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wind River near Crowheart. * WHEN...From this evening to Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Bankfull stage. At 9.5 feet, Very minor low land flooding begins. At 10.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor low land flooding becomes more widespread. Access road to gage begins to be covered with water. At 10.5 feet, Moderate low land flooding upstream and downstream of gage. Access to gage is becomes limited. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM MDT Saturday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 10.3 feet tomorrow (Sunday) afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Sunday evening.
